span.font:
apiVersion: core.gardener.cloud/v1beta1
kind: Shoot
metadata:
name: crazy-botany
namespace: garden-dev
spec:
secretBindingName: my-provider-account
cloudProfileName: cloudprofile1
region: europe-central-1
provider:
type: <some-provider-name> # {aws,azure,gcp,...}
infrastructureConfig:
<Infrastructure Provider Config>
controlPlaneConfig:
<ControlPlane Provider Config>
workers:
- name: cpu-worker
cri:
name: containerd
containerRuntimes:
- type: gvisor
minimum: 3
maximum: 5
machine: type: m5.large
image:
name: ubuntu / coreos / suse
version: 2023.5
providerConfig:
<OperatingSystem Provider Config>
volume:
type: gp2
size: 20Gi
providerConfig:
<Worker Provider Config>
caBundle:
<some-ca-bundle-to-be-installed-to-all-nodes-in-this-pool>
kubernetes:
kubelet:
cpuCFSQuota: true
cpuManagerPolicy: none
podPidsLimit: 10
imagePullProgressDeadline: 1m
maxPods: 110
<evictionHard / evictionSoft / evictionSoftGracePeriod / evictionMinimumReclaim>
featureGates:
SomeKubernetesFeature: true
zones:
- europe-central-1a
dns:
domain: crazy-botany.core.my-custom-domain.com
networking:
type: calico
pods: 100.96.0.0/11
nodes: 10.250.0.0/16
services: 100.64.0.0/13
providerConfig:
<Networking Provider Config>

div.div:
Ensure ShootState resource exists.
- This resource contains all the resources that are created by a Shoot reconciliation
flow in the Garden and Seed cluster (e.g generated certificates,
state of extension resources).
- It is used to be able to recover from Seed failures and to move the
Kubernetes Control Plane of a Cluster from one Seed to another.
- The ShootState resource is synced by a dedicated controller in the Gardenlet.

div.div:
AWS ensure (kube-apiserver)
Command Line Arguments
- Shoot with CSI (Kubernetes version >= 1.18)
- --feature-gates=CSIMigration=true,CSIMigrationAWS=true
- CSI migration complete (flags set right away for new clusters):
--feature-gates=CSIMigrationAWSComplete=true
--disable-admission-plugins=PersistentVolumeLabel
Shoot without CSI
- cloud-provider = aws
- cloud-config = etc/kubernetes/cloud/provider/cloudprovider.conf mounted from ConfigMap
- enable-admission-plugin=PersistentVolumeLable
EnvironmentVariables
Shoot without CSI
- AWS_ACCES_KEY_ID & AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
Volumes & Volume Mount
Shoot without CSI
- ConfigMap "cloud-provider-config" mounted to etc/../ cloudprovider.conf
- mount /etc/ssl & /usr/share/ca-certificates to have access to Root CA for Cloud provider API
Also ensure checksums & required network policy labels (see docs)

Also ensure checksums & required network policy labels (seedocs)

pre.span:
apiVersion: extensions.gardener.cloud/v1alpha1
kind: OperatingSystemConfig
metadata:
name: cloud-config-<workerName>-downloader
namespace: shoot--<>dd
spec:
files:
- content:
inline:
data:
# Omitted: Shoot Api server TLS cert, cloud-config-downloader client cert & client key
# this is a placeholder. Read by the MCM from the machine class secret and before
# applied via user-data, transparently replaced with the MCM-created bootstrap token per VM
# Flow: OSC -> os-extension -> OSC.Status -> Worker.spec.pool.userData -> machine class secret
pre.font:
: |
[Unit]
Description=Downloads the actual cloud config from the Shoot API server and executes it
After=docker.service docker.socket
Wants=docker.socket
[Service]
Restart=always
RestartSec=30
EnvironmentFile=/etc/environment
ExecStart=

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 528px; height: 1px; padding-top: 3770px; margin-left: 2px;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

pre.span:
apiVersion: extensions.gardener.cloud/v1alpha1
kind: OperatingSystemConfig
metadata:
name: cloud-config-<worker pool name>-original
namespace: shoot--<>
spec:
files:
- ssl root certs under /etc/ssl/certs/
- docker.conf as systemd-drop-in units under /etc/systemd/
- journald.conf as systemd-drop-in units under /etc/systemd/
- kubelet ca.crt under /var/lib/kubelet/
- kubelet config under /var/lib/kubelet/config
- also contains kubelet flags defined in Shoot (eviction, max pods, ...)
- general host config under /etc/sysctl.d/99-k8s-general.conf (tcp settings, ...)
- health monitor scripts for kubelet, docker, containerd
- runs.sh script under /var/lib/gardener-user/run.sh that
adds gardener-suer and adds ssh key
- gardener-user-ssh.key under /var/lib for the gardener-user
purpose:
pre.font:
- docker-logrotate.service ExecStart=/usr/sbin/logrotate /etc/systemd/docker.conf
- docker-logrotate.timer Log rotation every 10 mins
- docker-monitor.service starting '/opt/bin/health-monitor' with parameter "docker"
- after kubelet

- containerd-logrotate.service /usr/sbin/logrotate /etc/systemd/containerd.conf
- containerd-logrotate.timer Log rotation every 10 mins
- containerd-monitor.service starting '/opt/bin/health-monitor' with parameter "containerd"
- after kubelet
- updatecacerts.service updating CA bundle at /etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt
- kubelet-monitor.service starting '/opt/bin/health-monitor' with parameter "kubelet"
- restart standart systemd-sysctl.service to intitially generate files in /etcd/sysctl.d/
- gardener-user.service executing /var/lib/gardener-user/run.sh to
add gardener-user and ssh key
- custom-mtu.service to apply a custom MTU to eth0 with 'ip' command
- kubelet.service
- after docker.service or after containerd.service
- Pre start executes 'docker run' to download hyperkube image -> cp to '/opt/bin/kubelet'
- starting kubelet under /opt/bin/kubelet
--bootstrap-kubeconfig=/var/lib/kubelet/kubeconfig-bootstrap \
--config=/var/lib/kubelet/config/kubelet \
--cni-bin-dir=/opt/cni/bin/ \
--cni-conf-dir=/etc/cni/net.d/ \
--pod-infra-container-image=<>/google_containers/<pause container> \
--kubeconfig=/var/lib/kubelet/kubeconfig-real \
--network-plugin=cni \
--node-labels="node.kubernetes.io/role=node,
worker.gardener.cloud/pool=<Shoot worker pool name>" \
--volume-plugin-dir=/var/lib/kubelet/volumeplugins \
--v=2 \
$KUBELET_EXTRA_ARGS \
pre.span: # all extra kubelet flags defined in Shoot.yaml

span.font: Goal: Translate OperatingSystemConfig Files and Units into OS specific user-data format (cloud-config(coreos), Ignition, cloud-init or

div.span: bash script translating `.spec.units` into `systemd` units, and `.spec.files` into real files on the disk
in place updates (no VM restart required).

span.font:
Supports encoding file content as base64 or unencoded based on the OSC file configuration.
This is important for the Bootstrap token placeholder <<BOOTSTRAP_TOKEN>> , that needs to be put unencoded in the user_data to be transparently replaced with the real token by the MCM before VM creation.
Save cloud-init in secret referenced in the OSC status.

div.div:
AWS ensure (OperatingSystemConfig-original)
Goal: Add/modify provider specific files and units to OSC specification before being reconciled by os-extension
Files
- /etc/sysctl.d/99-k8s-general.conf
- add property to content:net.ipv4.neigh.default.gc_thresh1=0
Service Units
- Kubelet.service
- Shoot with CSI - add flag:
--cloud-provider=external,
--enable-controller-attach-detach=true
-Shoot without CSI - add flag:
--cloud-provider=aws
- addExecStartPre=/bin/sh -c 'hostnamectl set-hostname $(hostname -f)'
- add unit 'custom-mtu.servce' setting mtu to 1460 for eth0

div.style: font-size: 9px

font.span:
- onesecret for each worker pool (namespace: kube-system, name: cloud-config-<worker-name>) , containing the cloud-config execution script.
This secret is downloaded by the downloader bash script when initially starting the VM (bash script created via user-data from OSC type provision) and also every 30 seconds. It is the main responsible script for initially bootstrapping the OS and updating it.
Execution script contains the OSC (orginal) - status with the Os-specific user-data translated by the Os-extension (from Osc.status.cloudConfig.secret) and the units to restart (from Osc.status.units)

pre.pre:
apiVersion: extensions.gardener.cloud/<>
kind: Worker
metadata:
name: <shoot-name>
namespace: shoot--<>
spec:
# taken from Infrastructure.Status reconciled by provider-extension
# AWS: Contains the created VPC, security groups, subnets
# ec2 ssh key, iam instance profile & roles
infrastructureProviderStatus:
apiVersion: aws.provider.extensions.gardener.cloud/<>
kind: InfrastructureStatus
# <...>
pools:
- machineImage:
name: coreos
version: 2303.3.0
machineType: m5.large
maxSurge: 1
maxUnavailable: 0
maximum: 6
minimum: 2
name: cpu-worker
# computed previously by os-extension and read by Gardenlet
# contains <<BOOTSTRAP_TOKEN>> placeholder in cleartext
# will be put into machine class secret to be applied as user-data
userData: <User-data of downloader OSC from OSC.status.cloudConfig.secretRef>
volume: <>
# addition volumes, optionally encrypted
dataVolumes: <>
zones:
- eu-west-1a
region: eu-west-1
secretRef:
name: cloudprovider
namespace: shoot--<>
sshPublicKey: <>
type: aws

div.div:
Create with (Cloud) Provider
- Read user-data from secret referenced from MachineClass of the Machine
- Transparently replace placeholder <<BOOTSTRAP_TOKEN>> from user-data with thebootstrap tokencontent previously created in Shoots kube-system ns- hand over user-data to CloudProvider containing cloud-config with systemd unit starting the downloader script every 30 sec
- in node subnet in the VPC created in the Stakeholder's Cloud Provider account
- with shoot tags
- specified OS image (e.g. AMI) and MachineType
- MinMax count = 1(leverage K8 and not cloud provider's native scaling like Autoscaling Groups in AWS)
- with created IAM Instance Profile (Infrastructure)
- using created security groups (infrastructure)
- with block devices

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 328px; height: 1px; padding-top: 5035px; margin-left: 2145px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 9px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.span:
Update MachineStatus
The MCM updates the Machine with information obtained during instance creation.
It sets the providerID which encodes the actual cloud-provider instance identificator (AWS: instanceId, GCP: instance name) with the shoot region (e.g

AWS: aws:///<shoot-region>/<instance-id>)
It also right away sets the status.nodeName. This is possible before the creation of the node resource, as the MCM knows with which name the kubelet on each provider creates the Node object. (e.g On AWS its the privateDnsName of EC2 instance. On GCP it is the instance name.)

div.span: Execute user-data(originates from OSC downloader, spec.purpose = provision)
div.div: - only executed once when VM is created
- setup a systemd unit that executes the 'downloader script' every 30 sec
-systemctl enable & restart docker or containerd service (must be available / preinstalled on the OS for every Gardener node)
- create CA cert of the Shoot-API server
- containerd: create containerd.service drop-in to use config.toml file

switch.text: Execute user-data(originates from OSC downloader, spec.purpose = provision)...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 589px; height: 1px; padding-top: 5090px; margin-left: 3662px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 9px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

ul.li: Retrieves secret from Shoot-API server containing cloud-config-execution script:

li.span: secret kube-system/cloud-config-execution-<worker-name> deployed by managed resource 'shoot-cloud-config-<worker-name>' (one per worker pool)

ul.li: uses provided Shoot API server domain
Relies on created Roles & Bindings in the ShootAPI server that allows the user ''cloud-config-downloader"from the client cert to get the required secret
roles deployed by Gardener using ManagedResource / chart "shoot-cloud-config-rbac")
Writes checksum of the downloaded cloud config execution script to /var/lib/cloud-config-downloader/downloaded_checksum

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 659px; height: 1px; padding-top: 5330px; margin-left: 3662px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 9px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Cloud config execution script (stored under /var/lib/cloud-config-downloader/downloads/cloud_config.old)
- contains the OS-specific user-data translated from files and service by the OS-extension (from OSC.purpose = reconcile, original)
Also contains the downloader user-data (initially used when creating the VM). Reason: Otherwise cannot update the downloader script on new Gardener versions.
- Original user-data read by Gardenlet from OSC(original).status.cloud.config.secret & then embedded into this script & applied as secret to kube-system ns in Shoot
- Systemd services to reload taken from OSC(original).status.units
- OS specific user-data reload command taken fromOSC(original).status.command
Preload requiredhyperkubedocker images via 'docker pull' (Container Runtime has to be available in the OS!)
If worker.kubeletDataVolume is defined: format & mount data volume under specified path (will be mounted by systemd service unit var-lib mount to /var/lib)
Compute md5 checksum for current downloader script/var/lib/cloud-config-downloader and store under/var/lib/cloud-config-downloader/download-cloud-config.md5 (used to check if current downloader script is different from previously executed)
Ifvar/lib/kubelet/kubeconfig-realdoes not exist: create bootstrap kubeconfig in/var/lib/kubelet/kubeconfig-bootstrap. Containing: Shoot API Server domain, CA and generated bootstrap bearer token (old behaviour:all data embedded in script - bootstrap token also deployed to Shoot API server kube-system ns (requirement for Bootstrap tokens to be recognized as such by the Shoot API server. New behaviour: uses bootstrap token file with token originating from the MCM. Token file already created on VM creation by user data))
Createfile/var/lib/cloud-config-downloader/downloads/cloud_configusing the OS specific user-data generated by the OperatingSystemController -> embedded in script
Restart systemd services specified by annotation on Nodeworker.gardener.cloud/restart-systemd-services(remove annotation after)
If file not exists: compute delay up to 300s and store in/var/lib/cloud-config-downloader/execution_delay_seconds
if now() - lastExecution (from file) < executeDelaySeconds (from file) --> skip execution (will be retried by downloader script in 30 s)
Compare cloud_configfile with cloud_config.old file && downloader script checksums. If not equal: reload os specific user data (bash / cloud-init / ignition) containing all Gardener systemd services (units specified in OSC.status.units). Uses an os-specific reload command (from OSC.status.command) Example Command: /usr/bin/coreos-cloudinit --from-file=/var/lib/cloud-config-downloader/downloads/cloud_config
9. Update the checksum of the CloudConfigDownloader script (is included in the original cloud-config just executed)
10.Enables & restarts systemd units (read by Gardenlet from original OSC.status.units). The VM is updated without requiring a restart.
11. Stores annotationchecksum/cloud-config-data on the Node object with the checksum of the last applied cloud config
from file/var/lib/cloud-config-downloader/downloaded_checksum
12. Store last execution date in file/var/lib/cloud-config-downloader/execution_last_date

div.div:
General Extension Resources
- Enables support for extensions that are not required for Gardener's core functionality (in contrast to Infrastructure, Worker, ...).
- Prerequisite is a deployed extension controller in the seed reconciling an Extension with the specified type
- Currently available:
Shoot-cert-service providing TLS Let's Encrypt certificates for services & ingresses in the shoot
Shoot-dns-service providing managed DNS for services & ingresses in the shoot

div.div:
Overview of Admission Controllers in Gardener
Admission Plugins in the Gardener Extension API server
- The Gardener API server works with admission pluginsthat are compiled into the binary, to validate and mutate resources belonging to Gardener related API groups, e.g. `core.gardener.cloud`. You can find a list of plugins in the main Gardener repository underdocs/concepts/apiserver_admission_plugins.md.
Gardener Admission Controller
- Deployment in the Garden cluster servingadmission webhooks to validate mostly non-Gardener API group resources. Use cases are e.g to forbid namespace deletion that still contain Shoot resources, validating that kubeconfig in secret resources conform to Gardener standards or to protect against DDOs attacks by restricting resources sizes.. See the docsunder docs/concepts/admission-controller.md.
Gardener Extension Validator
This is an optional deployment in the Garden cluster per cloud providerto prevent that Shoots can be created with an invalid provider-specific configuration and then later fail to be created. The provider specific fields (providerConfigfields)of the Shoot resource cannot be validated by the Gardener API server during creation.
Which provider specifics can be configured in the Shoot resource depends on the Extension provider. There should be documentation in each repository of the extension provider e.g like for the Gardener Extension for AWS.
Gardener Seed Admission Controller
The Seed Admission controller is an optional deployment in a Gardener Seed cluster.
Its purpose is tosafeguard operations in the Seed cluster toprevent possibly fatal cascading deletions of Gardener extension resources. It serves a validating webhook on the Custom Resource Definitions (CRDs) of the extension resources (e.g Infrastructure, Worker) and forbids the deletion of the CRD if there are still API resources of the same kind deployed in the Seed cluster.

NOTE: This is the old mechanism. Using the feature gate BootstrapTokenProvidedByWorker, the Gardenlet no longer deploys the Bootstrap token itself but relies on the token created by the MCM per VM. See here for more information.
Deploy secret "bootstrap-token-<>" bootstrap token with 48 h validity to Shoot Apiserver (kube-system).
This token is required so that the API server can verify the boostrap token when using the Bootstrap kubeconfig during TLS bootstrapping.
The Token itself is embedded into the cloud-config-execution script and used when creating the kubelet Bootstrap kubeconfig.

div.div:
A Gardener installation must have exactly one "internal" DNS provider configured that is used to construct the "internal" domains of all Shoot clusters. This can be done by providing a properly labeled secret resource containing DNS provider credentials.The "internal" Shoot domain is used to communicate with the Shoot API server in orderto bootstrap & update the Shoot worker nodes(bootstrap Kubeconfig & download-cloud-config script)
and used by Kubernetes system components in the Shoot cluster (e.g kube-proxy).
Each Shootcan specify an "external" domain that should be created with a dns provider of choice. Thisis the external available domain of the Shoot cluster and is written into thekubeconfig that is handed out to end-users.
A Gardener installation must have exactly one "default" DNS provider configured that can be used in case the Shoot does not specify an external domain.
This can be done by providing aproperly labeled secret resourcecontaining DNS provider credentials.

div.div:
AWS ensure (kube-scheduler)
Command Line Arguments
- Shoot with CSI (Kubernetes version >= 1.18)
---feature-gates=CSIMigration=true,CSIMigrationAWS=true
- CSI migration complete (flags set right away for new clusters):
--feature-gates=CSIMigrationAWSComplete=true

div.div:
There are two controllers in the Gardenlet involving the BackupEntry.
- Shoot reconciliation: deploys BackupEntry into Garden cluster & waits for it to be reconciled
- BackupEntry controller: dedicated controller that observes the deployed the CRD and reconciles it. During the reconciliation, deploys another BackupEntry CRD to the Seed. Waits for the provider extension to reconcile it and reports back the status to the BackupEntry in the Garden cluster.
